summary: Feature request to help users debug the common issue of workflows not executing because no worker is polling the correct task queue. Proposes logging a helpful warning message when start/execute/signalWithStart is called and no workers are available on the specified queue.
userImpact: Users frequently encounter silent failures when workflows don't execute due to missing or misconfigured workers, leading to confusion and debugging difficulty.
rootCause: Lack of feedback when a workflow is started but no worker is available to process it on the specified task queue.
proposedFix: Add a warning log message when start/execute/signalWithStart is called in development mode and no workers are polling the target task queue.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by the Temporal UI providing a banner to help users identify missing workers on task queues.
keyQuote: There are no Workers polling on task queue 'my-queue'. In order to start running this workflow, run a Worker with `taskQueue: 'my-queue'`.
